name: Easy Run
description: Conversational pace run for building aerobic base. You should be able to talk throughout.

coach.intro: Today's an easy run. That means conversational pace — if you can't hold a conversation, you're going too fast. This is where fitness is actually built.
coach.motivation: Easy runs aren't lazy runs. They're smart runs. Trust the process.
coach.completion: Well done. Easy runs like this are the foundation of every runner's training.

structure.name: Warm-Up Walk
structure.notes: Brisk walk to warm up muscles and elevate heart rate gently

structure.name: Dynamic Warm-Up
structure.notes: Leg swings, high knees, butt kicks — 30 seconds each

structure.name: Easy Run
structure.notes: Conversational pace. If breathing hard, slow down. It's okay to walk briefly if needed.

structure.name: Cool-Down Walk
structure.notes: Gradually bring heart rate back down

paceGuidance.description: Easy pace means you can speak in full sentences. Heart rate roughly 60-70% of max.
paceGuidance.feel: Should feel comfortable. You could go faster, but you're choosing not to.
paceGuidance.common_mistake: Going too fast. Most runners do their easy runs too hard, which limits progress.
